intro: Matelea glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Matelea glaberrima is often found in desertscrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
